headline.main: SINKINGS QUICKEN TEMPO IN SENATE; Impetus Given to Removal of Ban on Ship Arming -- Hull Urges Sailings Anywhere

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21 -- Disclosure of the sinking of two more American-owned merchant ships combined today with the urgent appeals of Secretary Hull and Admiral Stark, Chief of Naval Operations, to give added impetus to quick Senate action on revision of the Neutrality Act to permit the arming of this country's merchantmen.
